newsitem.title: USA: Synovus CEO seeks higher return on assets.
newsitem.headline: Synovus CEO seeks higher return on assets.

text.p: Synovus Financial Corp's chief executive officer said on Wednesday he hopes to boost his company's banking operations' return on average assets significantly.
CEO James Blanchard told analysts at the annual Robinson-Humphrey Co Inc institutional conference that his goal is to raise return on assets to 1.8 percent in 3.5 years.

Blanchard stressed that he was referring to the return for banking operations only and was excluding the performance of the company's 82 percent-owned subsidiary Total System Services Inc, a processor of debit and bank cards.
Last year ROA for banking was 1.39 percent and this year it should be about 1.5 percent, Blanchard said.
